item.title: An R tool for assessing when averages are stable
item.description: This is a project for assessing when averages become stable. The R code can be found on Github at gabenespoli/resampling, and the working paper can be found on the OSF page (Open Science Framework).

item.title: Neuroscience of music and movement
item.description: My dissertation work investigates aspects of music that drive neural entrainment in motor areas of the brain. When listening to music, neurons in the brain can synchronize their firing with the beat. This neural entrainment is how we are able to predict when the next beat will occur, and thus how we can tap our feet or dance along. The ability of different music to compel movement in a listener varies, and this is likely also true of neural entrainment.

item.title: PHZLAB
item.description: PHZLAB is a MATLAB Toolbox for analyzing physiological data, both peripheral (e.g., EDA, EMG) and neural (i.e., ABR). It can be found on Github at gabenespoli/phzlab.

item.title: The effects of hearing aids on physiological responses to emotional speech
item.description: Perceiving emotion in speech is a common shortcoming of modern day hearing aids, which can often lead to difficulties understanding others. This project uses physiological measures to see the effects of hearing aids on physiological responses to emotion. Specifically we investigated skin conductance levels (SCL; a “sweat” response that is a good indicator of general arousal) in hearing-impaired and -aided listeners when listening to happy, sad, angry, and calm speech.
